name: congruent
condition_description: The color and word names match

name: incongruent
condition_description: The color and word names conflict with one another

name: neutral
condition_description: The word is not a color name

name: Go trial
condition_description: Trials on which a go stimulus is presented and the subject is expected to respond

name: Stop trial
condition_description: Trials on which a stop signal is presented at some delay (stop-signal delay) following the go stimulus, and the subject is expected to stop

name: Go trials
condition_description: Trials on which the stimulus is in the go category

name: Stop trial
condition_description: Trials on which the stimulus is in the stop category

name: 0-back
condition_description: A condition requiring stimulus matching but not working memory

name: 3-back
condition_description: A condition requiring memory for stimuli occurring 3 stimuli back

name: Target
condition_description: The stimulus to be responded to

name: Nontarget
condition_description: Any stimulus other than the target

name: 1-back
condition_description: A condition requiring memory for stimuli occurring 1 stimuli back

name: 2-back
condition_description: A condition requiring memory for stimuli occurring 2 stimuli back

name: 3-back
condition_description: A condition requiring memory for stimuli occurring 3 stimuli back

name: no delay
condition_description: No delay between initial presentation and probe

name: delay
condition_description: Probe presentation follows a delay after initial presentation

name: Matching
condition_description: The word and picture refer to the same concept

name: Non-matching
condition_description: The word and picture refer to different concepts

name: Segmented blocks
condition_description: None

name: Unsegmented blocks
condition_description: None

name: Difficulty Level 1
condition_description: All three stimulus dimensions must match

name: Difficulty Level 2
condition_description: Only two stimulus dimensions must match

name: Difficulty Level 3
condition_description: Only one stimulus dimension must match

name: First category
condition_description: The first category presented in the series

name: Subsequent categories
condition_description: Categories presented after the first in the series

name: Perseverative errors
condition_description: Errors that involve perseveration on the previously acquired set

name: Nonperseverative errors
condition_description: Errors that do not involve perseveration on the previously acquired set

name: Failure to maintain set
condition_description: Loss of the correct sorting rule during performance

name: Congruent
condition_description: Both body and head belong to the same animal

name: Incongruent
condition_description: Body and head belong to different types of animals

name: Switch trial
condition_description: Those trials on which subjects are required to switch from one task to another

name: Repeat trial
condition_description: Those trials on which subjects are required to repeat the same task that was performed on the previous trial

name: Words
condition_description: Valid words in the testing language for which the correct response is "Yes"

name: Pseudowords
condition_description: Pronounceable letter or phoneme strings which do not form a valid word in the testing language.  The correct response is "No"

name: Consonant letter strings
condition_description: In imaging studies (as opposed to purely behavioural expts) strings of consonants are often used as a nonlexical control condition because they do not engage the reading system to the same extent

name: Fixation
condition_description: A "baseline" condition when no letter string stimulus is presented and no response is expected

name: Successful Stop Trial
condition_description: A trial on which a stop signal is presented at a delay following the go stimulus, and the subject successfully withholds their response

name: Unsuccessful stop trial
condition_description: A trial on which a stop signal is presented at a delay following the go stimulus, and the subject fails to withhold their response

name: delay period distractor task
condition_description: an optional task performed during the delay period between target presentation and the response cue; tasks examples : number subtraction, word categorization

name: sensory modality
condition_description: This task is overwhelmingly performed with visual stimuli with a visual saccade response, however, a haptic version performed blind is described in Park & Holzman 1996.

name: Successful stop trial
condition_description: Stop trial on which subjects successfully inhibit

name: Junk trial
condition_description: A go trial on which subject failed to respond or responded incorrectly

name: Probabilistic classification trials
condition_description: Trials on which the subject classifies items

name: Go trials
condition_description: Trials on which a go stimulus is presented and the subject is expected to respond

name: Stop-critical trial
condition_description: Trials on which a stop signal is presented at some delay (stop-signal delay) following the go, and the stimulus is the critical stimulus, meaning that the subject is expected to stop

name: Stop-noncritical trial
condition_description: Trials on which a stop signal is presented at some delay (stop-signal delay) following the go, and the stimulus is the non-critical stimulus, meaning that the subject is not expected to stop

name: Word
condition_description: Pairs of real english words

name: Pseudoword
condition_description: Pairs of pseudowords

name: meaningful
condition_description: actions are common gestures

name: meaningless
condition_description: actions are novel, and have likely not been seen or performed by the participant before

name: antisaccade
condition_description: eye movements away from the fixation point

name: prosaccade
condition_description: eye movements toward the fixation point

name: forward
condition_description: participant repeats a string of digits in the order they were presented

name: backward
condition_description: participant repeats a string of digits in the reverse order, beginning with the last digit presented

name: control pump
condition_description: The participant pumps a control balloon which has no reward associated with it

name: explosion
condition_description: the balloon bursts and the participant loses all gains for the trial

name: short form
condition_description: 27 points, subjects match possible faces to one picture, the last seven questions use pictures different poses

name: long form
condition_description: 54 points, subjects complete the short form plus an additional nine questions with the pictures using alternate lighting and poses. Each picture has 3 possible matches during this portion

name: copying test
condition_description: participants copy pictures or geometric objects

name: size match
condition_description: participants judge whether two objects presented side-by-side are the same size

name: length match
condition_description: participants judge whether two objects presented side-by-side are the same length

name: orientation match
condition_description: participants judge whether two objects presented side-by-side are shown with the same orientation

name: position of gap match
condition_description: participants judge whether two objects presented side-by-side have a gap in the same position

name: overlapping figures test
condition_description: participants are asked to identify all the objects in pictures containing overlapping figures

name: object decision
condition_description: participants are shown pictures and asked to identify whether the object could be real or is unreal

name: minimal feature match
condition_description: participants are asked to select a picture that is the same as the original picture, but the saliency of the objectâs most distinctive feature is reduced

name: foreshortened view
condition_description: participants are asked to select a picture that is the same as the original picture, but the object's principle axis is foreshortened

name: drawing from memory test
condition_description: participants draw images varying in complexity from simple shapes to complex objects like faces

name: picture naming
condition_description: participants identify the names for pictures presented. Pictures are generally words used infrequently

name: immediate recall
condition_description: 16 words from four categories are presented to the participant, who is then asked to recall as many as possible in 5 consecutive trials

name: interference
condition_description: a list of other words is presented, and the participant is once again asked to recall the initial 16 words

name: long recall
condition_description: after 20 minutes have passed, the participant is again asked to recall as many words as possible from the original list of 16

name: recognition trial
condition_description: some researchers include a recognition trial at the end of the test, in which the participant is shown a list of words and asked which ones were on the original list

name: same images
condition_description: participants view 6 faces in a random order, then are given 3 forced-choice tasks per face they have seen, in which 2 distractor faces are added and the participant must choose which face they have seen before

name: novel images
condition_description: participants complete a forced-choice task as in the same images condition, but the original 6 faces are now shown in a different way (different lighting, new facial expression, etc.)

name: novel images with noise
condition_description: the participants complete a novel images forced-choice task, with Gaussian noise added

name: ratio
condition_description: each trial has different ratios of one color to the other, affecting the probability of selecting the right color for the token

name: stimulus
condition_description: a subject must watch for a stimulus to be presented in the way it was shown to them before the test, then must react by pressing a button

name: non-stimulus
condition_description: a subject is watching for a stimulus, but some other shape/picture/object is shown

name: right hand
condition_description: subjects are instructed to identify a stimulus or set of stimuli by pressing a button with the right hand

name: left hand
condition_description: subjects are instructed to identify a stimulus or set of stimuli by pressing a button with the left hand

name: risky option
condition_description: a choice that has a low probability of reward, but a higher reward than the non-risky option

name: non-risky option
condition_description: a choice that has a high probability of reward, but the reward is lower than in the risky option

name: conditioned stimulus
condition_description: a stimulus is presented that the subject has no instinctive response to, but the researcher hopes to create an automatic response to by pairing it with the unconditioned stimulus

name: unconditioned stimulus
condition_description: a stimulus that the subject has a natural, instinctive reaction to ( stimuli associated with pain, noise, fear, and reward are often used)

name: descending
condition_description: bets start high and decrease over time

name: meditation
condition_description: participant performs meditation of a specific subtype

name: ascending
condition_description: possible bets start low and increase over time

name: formulating sentences subtest
condition_description: participant is asked to use a specific word or phrase correctly in a sentence to describe a picture

name: recalling sentences subtest
condition_description: participant is asked to repeat a sentence

name: sentence structure subtest
condition_description: participant responds to sentences of varying difficulty and structure

name: concepts and directions subtest
condition_description: participant is asked to follow directions that become increasingly difficult and cover a range of language concepts

name: word classes subtest
condition_description: participants must identify how words relate to each other (synonyms/antonyms, types, etc.)

name: word structure subtest
condition_description: assesses participants understanding of morphology

name: semantic relationships subtest
condition_description: only administered to children 9 years and older, assesses ability to understand semantic relationships

name: sentence assembly subtest
condition_description: only administered to children 9 years and older, participant is given words or phrases and asked to construct sentences using them

name: Stimulation at PT-0.7Â°C
condition_description: Heat stimulation at pain threshold minus 0.7Â°C

name: Stimulation at PT-1.0Â°C
condition_description: Heat stimulation at pain threshold minus 1.0Â°C

name: hider
condition_description: the subject hides an object and is encouraged to mislead the experimenter or other participant about where the object is hidden

name: guesser
condition_description: the experimenter or another participant hides an object and clearly tries to decieve the subject about where the object is hidden. In this task the experimenter is trying to ascertain whether the subject has the theory of mind to identify deceptive intent in others.

name: valid
condition_description: a subject is given a syllogism and asked to complete it or, if complete, to judge whether it is logically sound

name: invalid
condition_description: a subject is given an illogical syllogism and asked to judge whether it is logically sound

name: positive feedback
condition_description: the participant chooses a box containing a prize

name: negative feedback
condition_description: the participant chooses the devil box and loses all previous gains

name: immediate memory copy
condition_description: in this version of the digit/symbol coding test, participants are shown a list of digits and symbols and immediately asked to write down the symbols that correspond to a list of digits

name: general memory copy
condition_description: in this version of the digit/symbol coding test, participants are given time to study a list of digits and symbols and, after a period of time, asked to write down the symbols that correspond to a list of digits

name: verbal recall (people test)
condition_description: participants are shown picures of people with names and occupations (or other information) attached. They are asked to recall the names when prompted with the occupation

name: visual recognition (doors test)
condition_description: participants view pictures of doors. They then are presented with groupings of doors, each containing one from the studyied photos and 3 distractors and asked to identify the familiar door

name: visual recall (shapes test)
condition_description: participants copy line drawings that resemble crosses, then they are asked to redraw the shapes from memory

name: verbal recognition (names test)
condition_description: participants view a list of names. They then are presented with groupings of names, each containing one from the studyied list and 3 distractors and asked to identify the familiar name

name: congruent
condition_description: the participant is shown a stimulus flanked by some congruent image (the same letter or number as the stimulus or arrows pointing in the same direction as the target stimulus)

name: incongruent
condition_description: the participant is shown a stimulus flanked by incongruent images (different letters or numbers or arrows pointing in the opposite direction)

name: emotion detection
condition_description: participants must indicate when the current faces emotion matches the emotion of the face presented n previously

name: identity detection
condition_description: participants must indicate when the current picture is of the same person as presented n previously

name: rhythm tap
condition_description: subject must tap a button each time they hear a tone or see a light flash, which is presented in a consistent rhythm. Then, they must continue tapping in this rhythm after the stimulus has ceased

name: time tap
condition_description: subject must tap a button as many times as possible in a period of 10 seconds. Usually repeated trials are administered and an average score is obtained.

name: emotion manipulation
condition_description: some words on the list have neutral meaning, while other words have highly emotional content

name: category list
condition_description: words on the list, even if organized randomly, come from distinct categories of association so the subject can group them together as a memorization strategy

name: Transformation plates
condition_description: plates are designed so that a person with deficient color vision will report a different digit than someone with normal color vision

name: Vanishing plates
condition_description: plates are designed to that a person with deficient color vision will not see any digits, while people with normal color vision will report some digit

name: Hidden Digits plates
condition_description: plates are designed so that a person with deficient color vision will report seeing a digit, while people with normal color vision will not

name: Contamination/Cleaning
condition_description: questions that assess whether the participant has abnormal standards of cleanliness or abnormal negative feelings associated with uncleanliness

name: Checking
condition_description: questions that assess whether the participant rechecks things that have been checked before, or checks things after certainty should already have been attained

name: Slowness
condition_description: questions that assess whether the participant takes longer than necessary to perform common tasks

name: Doubting
condition_description: questions that assess whether a participant requires an unrealistic amount of perfection or underestimates their ability to adequately perform tasks or make moral decisions

name: Comprehension
condition_description: subjects are played music and tested to see if they processed it, remembered it, or had the same auditory experience as others

name: Production
condition_description: subjects are asked to play or sing music

name: Uncued
condition_description: The subject is not shown a cue prior to the appearance of the stimulus

name: Congruent Cue
condition_description: A cue appears before the target stimulus. This cue is in the same location as the target stimulus (a location cue) or pointing in the direction of the target stimulus (an orientation cue).

name: Incongruent Cue
condition_description: A cue appears before the target stimulus, but in another location or orientation.

name: Word
condition_description: participants are presented with a real word

name: Morphologically Decomposable Pseudowords
condition_description: participants are presented with pseudowords whose structure contains morphemes that commonly exist in their language

name: Morphologically Non-decomposable Pseudowords
condition_description: participants are presented with pseudowords that do not have morphological structure

name: Semantically correct
condition_description: participants view sentences that are semantically correct and would make sense in everday speech (e.g. "Did the visitor that admired the plants leave the wallet in the room?")

name: Semantically anomalous
condition_description: participants view sentences that are semantically incorrect and would not make sense (e.g. "The boys admired the curly, new car of the secretary in the office.")

name: Semantically associated items
condition_description: participants view items that have some semantic association (e.g. "car" and "truck")

name: Semantically unrelated items
condition_description: participants view items that have no strong semantic association between them (e.g. "shirt" and "airplane")

name: Congruent Cue
condition_description: Participants view stimuli that are pointing in the same direction as the visual field they appear in, or participants press a button that resembles the stimulus or visual field (i.e. pressing a right arrow on a keyboard when a right-facing arrow appears, or the stimulus is in the right visual field)

name: Incongruent Cue
condition_description: Participants view stimuli that are pointing opposite the visual field they appear in, or the participants press a button that is opposite the stimulus direction or visual field (i.e. pressing a left arrow on a keyboard when a right-facing arrow appears, or when the stimulus is in the right visual field)

name: 0-back
condition_description: participants are asked to identify the spatial location of the dot in the current picture

name: 1-back
condition_description: participants are asked to identify the spatial location of the dot presented 1 picture previously, or indicate whether the current dot matches the position of the dot in the previous picture

name: 2-back
condition_description: participants are asked to identify the spatial location of the dot presented 2 pictures previously, or indicate whether the current dot matches the position of the dot in the picture presented 2 previously

name: 3-back
condition_description: participants are asked to identify the spatial location of the dot presented 3 pictures previously, or indicate whether the current dot matches the position of the dot in the picture presented 3 previously

name: Trait Anxiety
condition_description: this half of the questionnaire evaluates how the participant feels in general

name: State Anxiety
condition_description: this half of the questionnaire evaluates how the participant feels at the moment. This half is more likely to change with re-administration of the questionnaire

name: congruent
condition_description: the word is printed in the color that its name suggests (e.g. "yellow" printed in yellow ink)

name: incongruent
condition_description: the word is printed in a different color than its name suggests (e.g. "yellow" printed in red ink)

name: Plausible Sentences
condition_description: participants view sentences that are grammatically correct and plausible as real sentences

name: Implausible Snetences
condition_description: participants view sentences that are grammatically incorrect and implausible as real sentences

name: Single Number
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a specific number each time it appears on a printed page with random sequences of numbers

name: Single Geometric Form
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a specific symbol or drawing each time it appears on a printed page with random sequences of geometric forms

name: Single Nonsense Letter
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a single, specific letter each time it appears on a printed page with random sequences of letters

name: Gestalt Figure
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a complex figure each time it appears on a page with a random sequences of similarly constructed complex figures

name: Single Letter
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a single, specific letter each time it appears on a printed page with random sequences of letters. Unlike the nonsense letter subtest, this test utilizes real letters from the alphabet of the participant's first language

name: Single Letter in Syllable Context
condition_description: participants are asked to underline all syllables containing a specific letter on a page of random sequences of syllables.

name: Two Letters
condition_description: participants are asked to underline two different, real letters each time they appear on a printed page with random sequences of letters

name: Sequence of Geometric Forms
condition_description: a page is filled with different orders of four geometric shapes. The participant is asked to underline the symbols when they occur in a specific order (e.g. triangle, then cross, then crescent, then circle)

name: Four-Letter Nonsense Syllable (Unpronounceable)
condition_description: a page is filled with random collections of syllables containing no vowels, and must underline a specific nonsense syllable (e.g. fsbm) each time it appears

name: Four-Letter Nonsense Syllable (Pronounceable)
condition_description: a page is filled with random collections of syllables containing vowels, and must underline a specific nonsense syllable (e.g. funp) each time it appears

name: Four-Letter Word
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a specific four-letter word each time it appears on a page filled with random sequences of other four-letter words made up of the same letters as the target word

name: Unspaced Four-Letter Word
condition_description: participants are asked to underline a specific four-letter word each time it appears on a page filled with random sequences of other four-letter words made up of the same letters as the target word. Unlike the Four-Letter Word subtest, this subtest does not include spaces in between the four-letter words

name: Single Number (Second Time)
condition_description: participants repeat the first subtest, but search for a different number this time

name: Congruent Cue
condition_description: a visual cue appears in the same place as the target will appear, but slightly early

name: Incongruent Cue
condition_description: a visual cue appears before the target does, but in a different location

name: RMW
condition_description: participant is shown words and asked to later identify which ones have been seen before

name: RMF
condition_description: participant is shown faces and asked to later identify which ones have been seen before

name: Matrix Reasoning
condition_description: assesses the fluid intelligence of the participant

name: Block Design
condition_description: assesses spatial abilities of participants

name: Similarities
condition_description: assesses semantic knowledge and verbal ability of the participant

name: Vocabulary
condition_description: assesses the vocabulary and lexical knowledge of the participant

name: Information
condition_description: the participant is asked questions to measure general knowledge

name: Digit Span
condition_description: the participant is given a set of digits to repeat either forward or backward. The set grows each time until the participant can no longer correctly recall all the digits in order

name: Vocabulary
condition_description: the participant is asked to define 35 words

name: Arithmetic
condition_description: the participant is asked to solve 14 story problems with mental arithmetic

name: Comprehension
condition_description: the participant is asked 16 questions about social awareness

name: Similarities
condition_description: the participant is asked to say how seemingly dissibmilar items might be similar

name: Picture Completion
condition_description: the participant is asked to identify the vital missing detail in 20 pictures

name: Picture Arrangement
condition_description: the participant is given 10 sets of pictures and must arrange each set into a logical sequence

name: Block Design
condition_description: the participant mut assemble blocks to match pictures of designs

name: Digit Symbol
condition_description: the participant use a key - which pairs each number with a symbol - to identify which digit matches the symbols they are presented with

name: Object Assembly
condition_description: the participant completes puzzles

name: Vocabulary
condition_description: the participant is asked to define words

name: Information
condition_description: the participant is asked questions to measure general knowledge

name: Logical Memory
condition_description: participants must recall or recognize elements from a short story

name: Verbal Paired Associates
condition_description: participants must recall or recognize a word when prompted by an unrelated word that was paired with it during the presentation of word pairs

name: Designs
condition_description: participants must recall visual details and spatial locations of designs

name: Visual Reproduction
condition_description: participants view a picture and reproduce it after it has been taken away

name: Spatial Addition
condition_description: participants manipulate visuospatial information in their working memory

name: Symbol Span
condition_description: participants must recall sequences of symbols, increasing in size with each correct completion

name: perceptual identification
condition_description: a word is presented extremely briefly (and often tachistoscopically) on a computer screen and the participant is asked to say the word aloud when they see it

name: lexical decision
condition_description: a string of letters is presented and the participant is asked to identify whether the letters form a word or not

name: latency identification
condition_description: words are presented that the participant is asked to read, but some words are very common and others are used infrequently

name: primed identification
condition_description: participants are shown words that are semantically or structurally similar to the target word before the target word, which they are asked to read, appears

name: Trait Affect
condition_description: how the participant would answer questions in general

name: State Affect
condition_description: how the participant would answer questions at the moment, or over the past few days

name: Early Blind
condition_description: subjects who have been blind since birth or before the acquisition of developed language and/or reading skills

name: Late Blind
condition_description: subjects who lost their sight after acquiring the ability to read non-braille text

name: Initiation
condition_description: participants were instructed to complete a series of 15 sentences (e.g., He posted the letter without a â¦.) using the contextually predicted word (STAMP)

name: Inhibition
condition_description: participants were instructed to complete a series of 15 sentences (e.g., He posted the letter without a â¦.) using totally unconnected words (e.g. BANANA)

name: 0-back
condition_description: participant is shown or read a list of letters and then asked to identify the last letter given

name: 1-back
condition_description: participant is shown or read a list of letters and then asked to identify the letter given 1 letter previously

name: 2-back
condition_description: participant is shown or read a list of letters and then asked to identify the letter given 2 letters previously

name: 3-back
condition_description: participant is shown or read a list of letters and then asked to identify the letter given 3 letters previously, or asked if the current letter matches the letter given 3 letters back

name: cue onset asynchrony
condition_description: different onset lags between the two cues (e.g., the auditory onset is 50ms after visual onset)

name: cue onset asynchrony
condition_description: different onset lags between the two cues (e.g., the auditory onset is 50ms after visual onset)

name: neutral
condition_description: the stimulus is a non-color word or nonword (e.g., "house" or "XXXX" printed in red ink")

name: verum acupuncture
condition_description: needles placed according to guidelines usually derived from traditional Chinese practice

name: sham acupuncture
condition_description: needles placed at locations not corresponding to guidelines

name: No-switch trials
condition_description: trials that are preceeded by trials of the same type

name: Switch trials
condition_description: trials that are preceeded by trials of the other task type

name: Common animals
condition_description: Animals that are frequent and commonly known (e.g., horse)

name: Rare animals
condition_description: Animals that are not commonly encountered or known (e.g., egret)

name: Congruent
condition_description: flanker items indicate same response as target

name: Incongruent
condition_description: flanker items indicate opposite response as target

name: Neutral
condition_description: flanker items do not indicate either response

name: Cue: none
condition_description: no cue precedes trial

name: Cue: double
condition_description: cue precedes trial but provides no information about the location of the upcoming stimulus

name: Cue: spatial
condition_description: cue precedes trial and can predict location of upcoming stimulus

name: Target
condition_description: An "X" that is preceded by an "A"

name: Distractors
condition_description: All other items (including the "A" and any "X" not preceded by an "A"

name: Baseline
condition_description: Stimulation at skin temperature

name: Heat Stimulation
condition_description: Stimulation at a temperature above pain threshold

name: Body ownership
condition_description: Synchronous paintbrush stroking of the occluded hand and the rubber hand elicits the illusion of the rubber hand being part of oneâs body.

name: No body ownership
condition_description: Asynchronous paintbrush stroking of the occluded hand and the rubber hand.

name: Noxious stimulation
condition_description: Painful stimuli (e.g. sharp tips) are delivered to the skin

name: Non-noxious stimulation
condition_description: Non-painful stimuli (e.g. blunt tips) are delivered to the skin

name: Stimulation at PT+0.7Â°C
condition_description: Heat stimulation at pain threshold plus 0.7Â°C

name: Stimulation at PT+1.3Â°C
condition_description: Heat stimulation at pain threshold plus 1.3Â°C

name: Baseline
condition_description: Rest, stimulation at skin temperature

name: Baseline
condition_description: Stimulation with indifferent temperature â not warm and not cold (around skin temperature)

name: Warm
condition_description: Stimulation with warm, but not painful, temperature

name: Cool
condition_description: Stimulation with cold, but not painful, temperature

name: Heat pain
condition_description: Stimulation with painful heat stimulus

name: Cold pain
condition_description: Stimulation with painful cold stimulus

name: Thermal grill
condition_description: Stimulation with thermal grill

name: No Pain
condition_description: Not painful thermal (hot/cold), electrical, chemical or mechanical stimulation

name: Pain
condition_description: Painful thermal (hot/cold), electrical, chemical or mechanical stimulation

name: No Pain
condition_description: Not painful thermal (hot/cold), electrical, or mechanical stimulation

name: Pain
condition_description: Painful thermal (hot/cold), electrical, or mechanical stimulation

name: Noxious Cold
condition_description: A noxious cold stimulus is applied to the skin

name: Innocuous Cool
condition_description: An innocuous cool stimulus is applied to the skin

name: Neutral
condition_description: A neutral thermal stimulus is applied to the skin

name: Painful
condition_description: Application of a painful electric stimulus

name: Non-Painful
condition_description: Application of a non-painful electric stimulus

name: Baseline
condition_description: Rest

name: Capsaicin-Evoked Pain
condition_description: Intradermal injection of capsaicin

name: Rest
condition_description: Rest, no stimulation

name: Baseline
condition_description: Stimulation at skin temperature

name: Heat Stimulation
condition_description: Heat stimulus above pain threshold

name: Cold Task
condition_description: Application of cold but not painful water

name: Pain Task
condition_description: Application of painful cold water

name: Baseline
condition_description: No application of water

name: Match trials
condition_description: Trials on which the same shape is presented twice

name: Mismatch trials
condition_description: Trials on which different objects are presented

name: Deterministic classification trials
condition_description: trials on which the subject classifies items

name: blocks of both probabilistic classification trials and deterministic classification trials
condition_text: blocks of both probabilistic classification trials and deterministic classification trials
condition_description: trials on which the subject classifies items

name: tone counting trials
condition_description: trials on which a subject listens and rembers that a tone was presented

name: classification learning trials
condition_description: trials on which the subject classifies items

name: classification learning trials
condition_description: trials on which the subject classifies items while also listening for a specific tone and keeps count of how many times it occurs

name: tone-counting probe
condition_description: probe for the number of times that the relevant tone was presented

name: Gamble judgment
condition_description: Judgment of whether to accept or reject a particular gamble

name: feedback
condition_description: presentation of feedback following response

name: Classification trials: Probabilistic
condition_description: Classification on items learned with probabilistic feedback

name: Classification trials: Deterministic
condition_description: Classification on items learned with deterministic feedback

name: Failed stop trial
condition_description: Trial on which subject fails to successfully inhibit

name: Junk trial
condition_description: Go trial on which subject fails to respond or responds incorrectly

name: Go trials - critical

name: Failed stop trial - noncritical
condition_description: Trials on which a stop signal was presented and the response was the noncritical one (i.e., the one that should not be inhibited)

name: Probe
condition_description: Probe asking which of two numbers is higher

name: Congruent Correct
condition_description: the participant is shown a stimulus flanked by some congruent image (the same letter or number as the stimulus or arrows pointing in the same direction as the target stimulus) and makes a correct response

name: Congruent Incorrect
condition_description: the participant is shown a stimulus flanked by some congruent image (the same letter or number as the stimulus or arrows pointing in the same direction as the target stimulus) and makes an incorrect response

name: Incongruent Correct
condition_description: the participant is shown a stimulus flanked by incongruent images (different letters or numbers or arrows pointing in the opposite direction) and makes a correct response

name: Incongruent Incorrect
condition_description: the participant is shown a stimulus flanked by incongruent images (different letters or numbers or arrows pointing in the opposite direction) and makes an incorrect response

name: Go trials - critical
condition_description: Go trial on which the response corresponds to the one that should be inhibited on stop trials

name: Go trials - noncritical
condition_description: Go trial on which the response corresponds to the one that should not be inhibited on stop trials

name: Successful stop
condition_description: Stop trial on which subjects successfully inhibit

name: Failed stop trial - critical
condition_description: Trials on which a stop signal was presented and the response was the critical one (i.e., the one that should be inhibited)

condition_description: Trials on which a stop signal was presented and the response was the noncritical one (i.e., the one that should not be inhibited)

condition_description: Go trial on which subject fails to respond or responds incorrectly

name: correct recall
condition_description: None

name: pump

name: cash-out
condition_description: The participant decides to stop pumping and put current earnings into the bank.

name: in-phase
condition_description: movement is consistent between hands

name: out-of-phase
condition_description: movement is different between hands

name: invariant
condition_description: distractor stimuli locations repeated across blocks within a session

name: variable
condition_description: distractor stimuli locations generated anew for each block within a session

name: congruent
condition_description: None

name: incongruent
condition_description: None

name: neutral
condition_description: None

name: consistent
condition_description: number is in a circle whose color follows the pattern specified

name: inconsistent
condition_description: number is in a circle whose color does not follow the pattern specified

name: part 1
condition_description: participant is to make pencil line connections in numerical order between 25 encircled numbers which are randomly arranged; odd numbers are in pink and even numbers are in yellow

name: part 2
condition_description: all numbers 1-25 are shown twice, once in pink and once in yellow; participant is to connect in sequential order and to alternate between colors, ignoring circled numbers out of pattern

name: synonymous
condition_description: word played in unattended channel is synonymous with that being played concurrently in attended channel

name: associated
condition_description: word played in unattended channel is related to but not synonymous with that being played concurrently in attended channel

name: unassociated
condition_description: word being played in unattended channel is entirely unrelated to that being played concurrently in attended channel

name: identical
condition_description: second number is identical to the first

name: false alarm
condition_description: second number is similar to the first in composition and order, but one digit is different

name: different
condition_description: second number is dissimilar from first

name: false alarm
condition_description: second number is similar to the first in composition and order, but one digit is different

name: identical
condition_description: second number is identical to the first

name: different
condition_description: second number is dissimilar from first

name: short
condition_description: delay of 5 seconds

name: long
condition_description: delay of 60 seconds

name: one cue
condition_description: one dot-shaped cue appears at a time

name: two cues
condition_description: two dot-shaped cues appear at a time

name: standard
condition_description: participants are shown an 8.5"x11" sheet of paper with a 15cm x 10cm array of numbers and are instructed to cross out specific numbers

name: distraction
condition_description: like standard except that participants are to ignore numbers being read aloud at a rate of 1/s through earphones while completing the task

name: valid
condition_description: probe is preceded by specified cue

name: invalid
condition_description: probe is preceded by non-specified cue

name: control
condition_description: each task performed individually

name: dual
condition_description: tasks performed simultaneously

name: experimental
condition_description: a distractor from the prime trial is the target in the test trial

name: control
condition_description: neither targets nor distractors are repeated across trials

name: 1 syllable
condition_description: None

name: 2 syllables
condition_description: None

name: 3 syllables
condition_description: None

name: 4 syllables
condition_description: None

name: Arabic
condition_description: numberals are represented in the Arabic system

name: verbal
condition_description: numerals are represented as words

name: wordlike
condition_description: nonwords more closely resemble real words

name: less wordlike
condition_description: nonwords less closely resemble real words

name: congruent
condition_description: name matches drawing

name: incongruent
condition_description: name does not match drawing

name: time-based
condition_description: remembering to perform task in specified intervals

name: event-based
condition_description: remembering to perform task after a specified event

name: high importance
condition_description: task described as more important than alternative task

name: low importance
condition_description: task described as less important than alternative task

name: normal
condition_description: participant is only given prospective memory tasks

name: demanding
condition_description: participant performs prospective memory task and a competing task (e.g. listening for a digit named in an auditory stream)

name: related
condition_description: prime is related to target

name: unrelated
condition_description: prime is unrelated to target

name: identical
condition_description: prime is identical to target

name: unprimed
condition_description: only target is presented

name: target infrequent
condition_description: the first half of the test, in which the target:nontarget ratio is 1:3.5

name: target frequent
condition_description: the second half of the test, in which the target:nontarget ratio is 3.5:1

name: amnesic
condition_description: participants have severely impaired declarative memory

name: walker
condition_description: points of light move at a rate and in a direction generated by an algorithm approximating human walking

name: scrambled walker
condition_description: point of light mirror the direction and speed of walker points, but their x or y coordinates are randomly shifted

name: control
condition_description: participant performs engages in an analogous activity

name: positive reinforcement
condition_description: behavior is followed by grant of a rewarding stimulus

name: negative reinforcement
condition_description: behavior is followed by removal of an aversive stimulus

name: positive punishment
condition_description: behavior is followed by grant of an aversive stimulus

name: negative punishment
condition_description: behavior is followed by removal of a rewarding stimulus

name: N (neutral)
condition_description: no aversive stimulus presented

name: P (predictable)
condition_description: aversive stimulus only presented after a specific cue

name: U (unpredictable)
condition_description: aversive stimulus presented without relationship to cue

name: cued
condition_description: segment within a given trial (either N, P, or U) during which cue is present

name: uncued
condition_description: segment within a given trial (either N, P, or U) during which cue is absent

name: subitizing
condition_description: the number of items to be counted is below a threshold above which participants must actively count, typically less than 4

name: counting
condition_description: the number of items is past a certain threshold beyond which participants must actively count, typically >4

name: low load
condition_description: items to be counted are appraised for one feature (e.g. color or arrangement)

name: high load
condition_description: items to be counted are appraised for more than one feature (e.g. color and arrangement)

name: method of limits
condition_description: None

name: staircase method
condition_description: None

name: random
condition_description: some proportion of dots is moving in a particular motion while the rest move randomly
dots other than those in target array move in a specific direction

name: operation span
condition_description: Presentation of mathematical verification followed by word

name: sleep deprived
condition_description: the subjects have not had adequate sleep for one or more nights

name: controls
condition_description: the subjects get adequate sleep or have not undergone neurobehavioral change

name: congruent
condition_description: the associations are congruent with the participant's beliefs (i.e. negative words are associated with obesity when the participant has an implicit bias against the obese)

name: incongruent
condition_description: the associations are incongruent with the participant's beliefs (i.e. positive words are associated with obesity when the participant has an implicit bias against the obese)

name: threat-congruent
condition_description: trials where a threat stimulus appears in the same spatial location as a probe

name: threat-incongruent
condition_description: trial where a threat appears on the opposite spatial hemi-field as a probe

name: reward-congruent
condition_description: trials where a positive-valence stimulus appears in the same sptial location as a probe

name: reward-incongruent
condition_description: trials where a positive stimulus appears on the opposite spatial hemi-field as a probe

name: neutral
condition_description: trials where a probe follows two identical neutral stimuli

name: Valid HC-Hit Cue
condition_description: valid cue where following object was a subsequent high confidence hit

name: Valid HC-Hit Obj
condition_description: object that was a subsequent high confidence hit and that followed a valid cue

name: Valid LC-Hit Cue
condition_description: valid cue where following object was a subsequent low confidence hit

name: Valid LC-Hit Obj
condition_description: object that was a subsequent low confidence hit and that followed a valid cue

name: Valid Miss Cue
condition_description: valid cue where following object was a subsequent miss

name: Valid Miss Obj
condition_description: object that was a subsequent miss and that followed a valid cue

name: Invalid HC-Hit Cue
condition_description: invalid cue where following object was a subsequent high confidence hit

name: Invalid HC-Hit Obj
condition_description: object that was a subsequent high confidence hit and that followed an invalid cue

name: Invalid LC-Hit Cue
condition_description: invalid cue where following object was a subsequent low confidence hit

name: Invalid LC-Hit Obj
condition_description: object that was a subsequent low confidence hit and that followed an invalid cue

name: Invalid Miss Cue
condition_description: invalid cue where following object was a subsequent miss

name: Invalid Miss Obj
condition_description: object that was a subsequent miss and that followed an invalid cue

name: Valid Other Obj Cue
condition_description: valid cue where following stimulus was an untested or no response object

name: Valid Other Obj
condition_description: stimulus that was an untested or no response object and that followed a valid cue

name: Valid Other Greeble Cue
condition_description: valid cue where following stimulus was an untested or no response greeble

name: Valid Other Greeble
condition_description: stimulus that was an untested or no response greeble and that followed a valid cue

name: Invalid Other Greeble Cue
condition_description: invalid cue where following stimulus was an untested or no response greeble

name: Invalid Other Greeble
condition_description: stimulus that was an untested or no response greeble and that followed a invalid cue

name: Look Neutral Cue
condition_description: participant views a cue that signals to look at a neutral image

name: Look Negative Cue
condition_description: participant views a cue that signals to look at an aversive image

name: Reappraise Negative Cue
condition_description: participant looks at a cue that signals to reappraise an aversive image

name: look Neutral Stimulus
condition_description: participant views a neutral image

name: Look Negative Stimulus
condition_description: participant views an aversive image

name: Reappraise Negative Stimulus
condition_description: participant reappraises the emotional value of an aversive image so the emotional impact is less negative

name: Look Neutral Rating
condition_description: participants rate their negative affect after a neutral stimulus

name: Look Negative Rating
condition_description: participants rate their negative affect after an aversive stimulus

name: Reappraise Negative Rating
condition_description: participants rate their negative affect after they were asked to reappraise an aversive image

name: Look Neutral Anticipation
condition_description: anticipation trial that involves viewing a neutral cue without a neutral stimulus following the cue

name: Look Negative Anticipation
condition_description: anticipation trial that involves viewing a negative cue without a aversive stimulus following the cue

name: Reappraise Negative Anticipation
condition_description: anticipation trial that involves viewing a reappraisal cue without the aversive image appearing after the cue

name: control
condition_description: No background noise is heard; only the voice the participant is asked to repeat is audible.

name: word in noise
condition_description: Noise, such as other voices conversing, is heard in the background, and the participant must discriminate the voice.

name: age
condition_description: this task is often administered at multiple time points to determine improvement

name: Single dimension
condition_description: participants must match pictures based on one dimension (color, shape, type, size)

name: Switch dimensions
condition_description: participants must match pictures based on one dimension (color, shape, type, size), then switch to another. This may be repeated multiple times in one trial.

name: 1-List
condition_description: participants repeat items according to only one dimension

name: 2-List
condition_description: participants repeat items according to two dimensions

name: control
condition_description: the participant completes the task in what they would consider their normal state (naive to alterations by the experimenters)

name: subjective state
condition_description: the participant completes the task after an alteration to their subjective state has been made by the researchers (drug administered, a specific emotion elicited, etc.)

name: fixed win
condition_description: subject is awarded 100 points for a correct decision regardless of the number of boxes opened

name: decreasing win
condition_description: number of points that can be won for a correct decision starts at 250 and decreases by 10 points for every box touched

condition_description: participants listen to a false belief story

condition_description: participants answer a question about a picture of a false belief story

name: Immediate
condition_description: Participant is shown list immediately after learning target words

name: Delayed
condition_description: Participant is shown list 20 minutes after learning target words

name: forward
condition_description: the subject is given a set of numbers and asked to repeat them in the order given.

name: backward
condition_description: the subject is given a set of numbers and asked to repeat them in the opposite of the order given.

name: sequencing
condition_description: the subject is given a set of numbers and asked to list them in ascending order from smallest to largest.

name: response
condition_description: events on which the subject made a target detection response

name: Sentences
condition_description: None

name: Nonwords
condition_description: None

name: Response
condition_description: Subject responds to the probe

name: HE food choice period
condition_description: Visual presentation of high energy food stimulus

name: LE food choice period
condition_description: Visual presentation of low energy food stimulus

name: antisaccade
condition_description: eye movements away from the fixation point

name: prosaccade
condition_description: eye movements toward the fixation point

name: regulate up
condition_description: None

name: regulate down
condition_description: None

name: Recent Positive
condition_description: a member of the current trial training set and the preceding trial training set

name: Recent Negative
condition_description: a member of the preceding trial training set but not the current trial training set

name: Non-recent Positive
condition_description: a member of the current trial training set but not the preceding trial training set

name: Non-recent Negative
condition_description: not a member of the current trial training set or the preceding trial training set

name: Positive probe
condition_description: a letter that was in the memory set

name: Negative probe
condition_description: a letter that was in the forget set

name: Neutral probe
condition_description: a letter that was not in the training set

name: High-persistance (HP) environment
condition_description: delays were drawn uniformly from the values 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, 30, 35, 40.

name: Low-persistance (LP) environment
condition_description: delays were set to 90 s with probability of 0.5, and otherwise drawn uniformly from the values 5, 10, 15 and 20s.

name: Risk-Taking(RT)
condition_description: risk taking behavior

name: Risk-Perceptions(RP)
condition_description: perceptions of risk

name: Expected-Benefits(EB)
condition_description: expected value and risk

name: Finite Horizon
condition_description: small, fixed number of trials

name: Infinite Horizon
condition_description: unknown number of trials

name: neutral
condition_description: the position of the target digit is in the same position as the required hand response

name: interference
condition_description: the position of the target digit is in the opposite position as the required hand response

name: word reading
condition_description: word reading score

name: math calculation
condition_description: math calculation score

name: task A
condition_description:
The intention to perform task A is maintained during the delay 
phase.

name: task B
condition_description:
The intention to perform task B is maintained during the delay 
phase.

name: delay intention
condition_description: An intention is maintained during the delay phase.

name: no delay intention
condition_description: No intention is maintained during the delay phase.

name: Verbal recall Trial 3
condition_description: The final round of immediate verbal recall

name: Verbal recall delayed
condition_description: Verbal recall after a delay of 10-15 minutes

name: Visual recall trial 3
condition_description: The final round of immediate visual recall

name: Visual recall delayed
condition_description: Visual recall after a delay of 10-15 minutes

name: reverse role active
condition_description: reverse role errors for active voice sentences

name: reverse role passive
condition_description: reverse role errors for passive voice sentences

name: lexical active
condition_description: lexical errors for active voice sentences

name: lexical passive
condition_description: lexical errors for passive voice sentences

name: Naming
condition_description: Verbal naming of line drawings of three animals

name: Memory
condition_description: Memorisation of five spoken words (not scored)

name: Attention
condition_description: Forward and backward digit list repetition, vigilance (1-back) and serial 7s

name: Language
condition_description: Sentence repetition and letter fluency

name: Abstraction
condition_description: Category naming

name: Delayed recall
condition_description: Recall of the five words learned earlier

name: Orientation
condition_description: Date, month, year, day, place and city

name: past events
condition_description: A set of details (e.g., person, place, object) from participants' own autobiographical memories is presented on a screen and participants are asked to recall a past event in as much detail as possible

name: future events
condition_description: A set of details (e.g., person, place, object) that has been recombined from details of participants' autobiographical memories is presented on a screen and participants are asked to imagine a novel future event in as much detail as possible

name: CS- trial: 0% chance of aversive reinforcer, regardless of response
CS+ trial: aversive reinforcer administered [on 80% of trials], if no  avoidance response made
GS trial: 0% chance of aversive reinforcer, regardless of response
